task: Find the pronunciation and a sample sentence for the word \"pandemic.\","https://dictionary.cambridge.org/
observation: The most recent observations from visiting the Cambridge Dictionary page for "pandemic" show that the term is defined as an adjective referring to a disease existing in almost all of an area or among a group of people, animals, or plants. It is also defined as a noun describing such a disease. The pronunciation of "pandemic" is provided with UK and US phonetic transcriptions /pænˈdem.ɪk/ and audio icons allow for listening. Example sentences include: "In some parts of the world malaria is still pandemic," and "A report on pandemic flu said 'the potential for catastrophe is immense.'" This summary reflects only the latest observations, and the complete task history should be referred to for full context and details.
